intro: Anemone nikoensis, commonly known as the Niko's anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic species. The plant features showy, cup-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
